title: Chinese copper box Box

  physical_appearance: This is a circular gilded copper box
 decorated with Chinese motifs such as prunus trees
 pagodas
 birds
 and mythical animals all around. The motifs are carved on
 creating a raised appearanc
 on the top of the lid and around the circumference. There are some light marks on the box where the material is slightly worn out.

  subject_terms_1: exports birds (motifs) foliage (motif)

  subject_terms_2: Exports Motifs Boxes Copperwork

  subject_terms_3: Chinese decorative arts

  sgcool_label_text: This circular box with a lid is decorated with figures in a landscape. Prunus trees
 pagodas
 birds and mythical animals
 and a mounted scholar are set in a ring-punched ground. Made in gilded copper
 it could have been used to hold cosmetics or tobacco snuff. Chinese metalsmiths in Canton and in provincial centres throughout Southeast Asia produced large amounts of such boxes as part of the lively export trade in decorative objects from the seventeeth century.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a circular gilded copper box, decorated with Chinese motifs such as prunus trees, pagodas, birds, and mythical animals all around. The motifs are carved on, creating a raised appearanc, on the top of the lid and around the circumference. There are some light marks on the box where the material is slightly worn out.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This circular box with a lid is decorated with figures in a landscape. Prunus trees, pagodas, birds and mythical animals, and a mounted scholar are set in a ring-punched ground. Made in gilded copper, it could have been used to hold cosmetics or tobacco snuff. Chinese metalsmiths in Canton and in provincial centres throughout Southeast Asia produced large amounts of such boxes as part of the lively export trade in decorative objects from the seventeeth century.
